H0.text: Mutualism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H1.text: Competition is the best description of the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H2.text: Parasitism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

H3.text: Commensalism is the relationship between ticks and a dog.

A4.text: Borrelia, the cause of Lyme disease and relapsing fever, is transmitted by vectors, ticks of the genus Ixodes, from the diseases' reservoirs in animals such as deer.

A5.text: The deer tick Ixodes scapularis acts as a vector for diseases including Lyme disease, babesiosis, and anaplasmosis.
